content.p: The University of Nottingham (UNMC) is partnering with M-AeroTech Aerospace Malaysia Innovation Centre (AMIC) in conjunction with leading aerospace industries, Airbus Group and Rolls-Royce to bring its expertise in aerospace to the Asia Aerospace City (AAC), which launched its Research and Technology (R&T) Centre in Malaysia on 6 November 2014.The entire research initiative by the Centre amounts to RM15 million, offering our experience as a global aerospace centre of excellence through a substantial commitment of postgraduate scholarships and academic staff expertise. Mission Lead and conduct synergistic research with government, academia and industrial partners to stimulate innovation and creativity. Board Rolls-Royce Singapore Current Projects /Objectives Techno-economic studies of algal bio-jet fuel production process Technology for offshore cultivation of tropical seaweeds for the production of aviation fuel Public health intelligence network for dengue surveillance in Malaysia Development of scalable fixtures Development of bio-sourced composties for aerospace and automotive application Offshore cultivation of tropical macro-algae for the production of aviation jet fuel Online robot and machine planning in virtual environment telephone: +6 (03) 8924 8000 fax: +6 (03) 8924 8001
